page.title: 16WINDYHILL FARM.
page.content: { Windyhill Farm}is situated two miles east of Kendal in the parish of New Hutton. It is a{dairy farm}of fifty-two hectares and the milking cows are {Friesian.}Approximately seventy cows are milked daily in summer and eighty in winter. The milk is collected by tanker and taken to the Milk Marketing Board, where it is pasteurised. Mr. Knowles, the farmer, is helped by his son David and two sheep dogs. There is no hay-making, but two silo crops per year. Six{hens}are kept to provide eggs for the family and they have six cats. Mr. Knowles has four{tractors;}an International, a John Deere, a Ford and a Massey Ferguson. The farmhouse is fronted by a large landscaped garden which has a lily pond.
